title: easy2boot.. boot from internal secondary hard disk

forumNotes.author: wozz

forumNotes.author: alacran
forumNotes.content:
Easy 2 boot is designed for USB drives, with some Isos (usually Linux ones, but may be others) it makes use of the third partition to load and run them, so if you run it from an internal drive I see a very big risk to damage your actual partitions on your HDD's. Assuming you are running Win7, I would suggest you better copy **grldr** and **grldr.mbr** ([from grub4dos 0.46a](http://grub4dos.chenall.net/categories/downloads/ "External link")) to the boot partition and make your own **menu.lst** and using [BootIce](http://bbs.wuyou.net/forum.php?mod=viewthread&tid=57675&extra=page%3D1&page=1 "External link") create an entrance to your BCD to boot from grub4dos. This is the way I boot several Isos (located on Isos folder on any partition of my HDD). Another easier option is just copy **grldr** and your own **menu.lst** to Windows partition root and make a **boot.ini** file on boot partition as this: Spoiler \[boot loader\] timeout=3 \[operating systems\] c:\\grldr="Grubfor2" **Remember grub4dos do not run from UEFI - secure boot.** This is my menu.lst, you may use it as a reference:

Its "main" file is called grldr (and not grld).

forumNotes.author: Rootman
forumNotes.content:
Just curious as to why you wanted to do this? Is it simply to have easy access to like a Windows PE ISO to boot?

If so there is perhaps an easier alternative. As pointed out earlier if you are boot EFI then this will not work at all and your second disk method is the way to go. Google up EasyBCD and install it. In the lower half of the ADD NEW ENTRY menu is an entry that you can add an entry to an ISO for. A lot of ISOs work, some wonky ones won't. Add your ISO to the BCD menu and make sure you have the boot countdown enabled on the EDIT BOOT MENU of EasyBCD. Your Win PE or whatever ISO you add now becomes a selection on your Windows boot menu. I have it this way on all my systems and boot to my Win PE ISO for backups or maintenance as well as a few other ISO for other stuff.

I also have Easy2Boot on various thumb and USB HDDs that I can boot to in case my system partition gets hosed and I can't access the normal boot menu.
